text.0: agni be kind to us when we approach thee good as a friend to friend as sire and mother.
text.1: the races of mankind are great oppressors burn up malignity that strives against us.
text.2: agni burn up the unfriendly who are near us burn thou the foemans curse who pays no worship.
text.3: burn vasu thou who markest well the foolish let thine eternal nimble beams surround thee.
text.4: with fuel agni and with oil desirous mine offering i present for strength and conquest.
text.5: with prayer so far as i have power adoringthis hymn divine to gain a hundred treasures.
text.6: give with thy glow thou son of strength when lauded great vital power to those who toil to serve thee.
text.7: give richly agni to the viśvāmitras in rest and stir oft have we decked thy body.
text.8: give us o liberal lord great store of riches for agni such art thou when duly kindled.
text.9: thou in the happy singers home bestowest amply with arms extended things of beauty.
